intro: Qualea rupicola, commonly known as the rock welwitschia, is a rare and unique plant native to the Namib Desert. It is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that help it conserve water in its arid environment. The plant has a deep root system that allows it to access moisture from deep within the soil. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are pollinated by insects. Due to its slow growth and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species.
